page.title: 01UPPER KENT ESTUARY
page.content: This area is a tidal estuary beyond the confluence of the Rivers Kent, Bela and Gilpin. The small section of the Eastern shoreline of the estuary includes parts of the villages of {Storth}and{Sandside.} The major part - to the west of the estuary - is mainly woodland. There are low-lying arable farmlands and a few large dairy farms on the west, separated from the wooded area by a North/South mudstone outcrop. The main trunk road to{Barrow}and W. Cumbria effectively forms the northern boundary of the area, this road providing the only real link between the east and west. Roads within the western section are poor - only farm tracks and footpaths in the main.
